result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Aviles Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Orlando Aviles Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Orlando Aviles Jr. was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 12-15-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered WITH tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for TWO (2) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando Aviles Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Court sentenced defendant to serve TWO (2) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for TWO (2) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 12-15-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered WITH tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
Fokus Family Service progress report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court reviewed Fokus progress report.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to negotiations, Count 1 is dismissed.  As to Count 2:
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.    All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record

Defense request for a plea date for a DPA is approved.  Case is adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 22  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for 06-22-2015 at 08:30 am.
JUSTICE POINT PRETRIAL REPORT dated 05-04-15 received and filed

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with James Bowers, student intern under the supervision of attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Nicholas Cerwin for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/22/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Martiza U; Rosies on Water - 1111 N Water Street.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Orlando Aviles in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defense enters a plea of not guilty as to the Misdemeanor Count 2.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
